label: RATS TRAIL THE SOPHS FOR SNOW BALL ATTACK

resource.chars:
RATS TRAIL THE SOPHS
FOR SNOW BALL ATTACK

Members of the Freshman class
who have been cherishing mem-
ories of rat meetings had an op-
portunity to wreak vengeance last
Saturday when the Sophomores
were challenged to defend the
flagpole in a snow ball battle. As
the Sophs failed to make their ap-
pearance upon the battlefield, the
Freshmen proceeded to round them
up.
Many members of the Sophomore
class were forced to taste the snow
in front of Calvert Hall and divers
other places. It is the expressed
opinion of Carl Neunan and King
Ward that the present Freshman
class is the best they have seen and
Mit Collins claims acquaintance
with every snowflake on the hill.
Charlie extends his thanks to the
Freshmen for the barber bill
which Andy Gump, who later gave
an exhibition of his speed, ran up
in his desire to escape the “rats.”
